channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: North East CDC launches schemes to help residents find jobs in the community
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:19 PM

SINGAPORE - North East Community Development Council (CDC) has launched a raft of initiatives to help more than 4,000 residents find jobs amid the pandemic.

item.title: Green lane and commuting arrangement to be set up between Singapore and Malaysia
item.description:
June 27, 2020 4:17 PM

Travellers would have to adhere to a set of Covid-19 prevention and public health measures, which are still being discussed and will have to be mutually agreed upon by both countries.

item.title: 291 new coronavirus cases in Singapore, including 11 in the community
item.description:
June 27, 2020 3:11 PM

Migrant workers living in dormitories make up the vast majority of the new cases.

item.title: 47 more seniors appointed as ambassadors for the digital push
item.description:
June 27, 2020 3:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Another 47 seniors have been appointed as ambassadors of digital lifestyles, in hopes of inspiring more of their peers to embrace technology and adopt practices such as using e-payment methods and shopping online.

item.title: $1.36b package rolled out to help construction firms resume work safely amid coronavirus pandemic
item.description:
June 27, 2020 1:41 PM

SINGAPORE - A new $1.36 billion fund has been set up to help construction companies, among the hardest-hit by the Covid-19 pandemic, to safely restart work.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 27
item.description:
June 27, 2020 8:15 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday, June 27

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine may be available only next year: Experts
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Researchers here are less hopeful than a top US expert who said a vaccine could be ready by the end of this year.

item.title: Close to 650 Mindef personnel promoted
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Odd, unpredictable working hours and extended overseas stints are among the realities that Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) regulars and their families have to get used to.

item.title: Singapore GE2020: Navigating choppy waters amid shifting geopolitical tides
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

How do you sail a tiny boat through massive swells when there is a raging electrical storm, the rudder in the vessel isn't responding promptly enough to the steering, the familiar lighthouses along the coast have vanished from view and your GPS settings seem to have gone haywire unexpectedly?

item.title: Singapore GE2020: SDP's Chee Soon Juan in Bukit Batok
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Democratic Party (SDP) chief Chee Soon JuanÂ greeting a resident during a walkabout in Bukit Batok Central yesterday.

item.title: Most memorable mission: Rescue of injured worker
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite conducting many life-saving search and rescue missions, his first in 2012 is the most memorable for Super Puma pilot Muhammad Azlan Latiff, 35, of 126 Squadron.

item.title: App to compare grocery prices launched nationwide
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Shoppers can now compare grocery prices across different supermarkets from the comfort of their home during Singapore's safe reopening phase with the nationwide launch of mobile app Price Kaki.

item.title: Singapore GE2020: Public reminded to observe safe distancing when meeting candidates
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

As election season hots up, there is a greater need for people to observe safe distancing rules, especially when they encounter candidates on the campaign trail.

item.title: SAF warrant officer wants to inspire next generation
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

When he enlisted for basic military training (BMT) as a commando in 1996, Master Warrant Officer Maheswaran Franklin Miranda struggled to pass a 35m swimming test.

item.title: Khaw Boon Wan: Fix-it minister who took on tough assignments and got the job done
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

One measure of a minister is the toughness of the tasks handed to him by the prime minister, and on that score, few can match Mr Khaw.

item.title: Coronavirus: Man who met big group one of 6 new cases in community
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A man among the six community Covid-19 cases announced yesterday met a large group of people for sports and social activities.

item.title: Agri-food tech firms can tap $55m grant
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Over $55 million has been set aside by Enterprise Singapore (ESG) to help local agriculture and aquaculture companies grow.

item.title: Nightspots here more subdued than a week ago
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The atmosphere at popular nightspots in Singapore was markedly more sober last night - one week into phase two of post-circuit breaker measures, after initial episodes of over-exuberance led to some individuals and businesses running afoul of the law.

item.title: 33 days' jail for dentist who verbally abused police officers and hit one of them
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

While drunk, a dentist not only hurled vulgarities at police officers, but also struck one of them in the arm.

item.title: ST pocket money fund giving $1m in e-grants
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

To mark the 20th anniversary of The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund (STSPMF) and the newspaper's 175th anniversary this year, $1 million worth of e-grants will be given to 2,000 students from families in need.

item.title: Judge orders dad to stop stalking and harassing son
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A judge issued a personal protection order (PPO) against a 57-year-old father and in favour of his son.

item.title: Duo charged over transactions of luxury goods to N. Korea
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Two women are facing more than 100 charges after allegedly failing to inform the police about transactions involving the supply of luxury items to North Korea worth more than $6.6 million in total.

item.title: Map of immune system may point way to Covid-19 vaccine
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The immune system helps to protect a person against disease, but this defence does not always work as well as it should.

item.title: Places of worship welcome larger groups as religious services resume
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Religious services resumed smoothly yesterday as mosques, temples and other religious organisations opened their doors to larger groups of worshippers for the first time in at least two months.

item.title: Managing work and family under one roof
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The coronavirus pandemic has abruptly thrust us into the world of remote working.

item.title: Safe distancing with ease
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Price Kaki is just one of many platforms helping you shop and dine safely amid the Covid-19 pandemic. Get more help for different needs here:

item.title: Singapore's botanical specials
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A new species of orchid found in Singapore and nowhere else has been discovered at the Bukit Timah Nature Reserve.

item.title: Man who took part in threesome convicted of rape
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A 24-year-old man, who took up an offer from another man to join two sexual trysts with the latter's girlfriend without her knowledge and consent, was convicted of rape and other sexual offences yesterday.

item.title: Bangladeshi worker who dodged death discharged after nearly 5 months
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

He lost 24kg and came close to death a few times, but Singapore's Covid-19 case 42 was determined to pull through.

item.title: Phishing attacks last year tripled from 2018
item.description:
June 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of phishing attempts to trick users to give up personal information almost tripled last year from the year before, and doubled during the months when people had to stay home to stem the spread of Covid-19.
